question: Don't worry. I'll beat 'em off with a stick.
answer: Daddy What about my joke?

question: Knock knock.
answer: Who's there?

question: Old lady.
answer: Old lady who?

question: Karl ... wake up.
answer: I'm here, Mase. Where are you

question: On the Harbor ... south of Torrance. I got Calabrese right in my gunsights. If I had a Sidewinder missile, I could save the taxpayers a lot of money. Here he goes. I'm shutting down the radio, partner.
answer: Keep off the skyline, amigo. Lou Gossett just won Best Supporting.

question: -- Murder is a serious business, my friend. And an expensive one.
answer: You'll be well compensated, Calabrese. Money now -- and a lot more when I get into that office. You can take that to the bank.

question: Slowly ... slowly. Always with caution.
answer: I'm up to here with caution! That fuck lives on bean curd and alfalfa sprouts -- he ain't gonna die of natural causes.

question: All I'm counseling is a little patience. The man is public. He's in the paper every day.
answer: Yeah? Well, the next time I read about him, it better be in the obituaries.

question: You throwing away dimes now?
answer: This doesn't go out over the air, pal. For your ears only.

question: What's going down?
answer: Calabrese. I just got his ass -- on candid camera.

question: You're full of shit!
answer: Him and his gorilla Vitale. I got film and audio on both of them, laying out a hit. Two other guys I couldn't make out, but I'm sure they'll come up on the film. This is a big one, Carlito. Our own academy award. You ready?

question: Shoot.
answer: I want you to track down Morgensteen right now. If he's with that meter maid from Pico, crank her legs apart and pry him out of there.

question: He ain't gonna be happy.
answer: Screw his happiness. Tell him I want the lab open at six-thirty tomorrow morning. I want this film pushed to the max, and nobody but us to know about it. I know we got something here.

question: You bringing it in tonight?
answer: I promised my kid I'd be home. I'll be at the lab before dawn. How ya doing? Got any champagne?

question: I promised my kid I'd be home. I'll be at the lab before dawn. How ya doing? Got any champagne?
answer: Right next to the caviar. There's some in the big cooler.

question: You're not watching the Oscars?
answer: The Oscars? I hate the Oscars. Who needs the goddam movies? I get it all in here every night. Horror. Sex. Freaks. Violence. And I ain't gotta pay no four bucks.

question: You got a phone back there?
answer: Why ?

question: Punch nine-one-one.
answer: Sonsofbitches! You creeps ripped me off two weeks ago! Take it, man. Take my life's savings. Where is a cop when you goddam need one? I got half a mind to come out there and teach you sonofabitch --

question: Is that for me, Dad?
answer: You faker.

question: E.T. lost.
answer: Who won?

question: I dunno. Candy.
answer: Candy?

question: You know why E.T. lost?
answer: Why?

question: Cause they only let grownups vote. If kids had voted --
answer: -- We would have gave E.T. everything!

question: We would have given him everything.
answer: Yeah. Daddy -- tell me a knock-knock.

question: You know the rules. One joke a day. I have to make 'em last.
answer: There's blood on your jacket.

question: It's okay. It's not mine.
answer: If people knew how sweet you are, they'd never be scared of you. I'm not scared of you.

question: Maybe you should be.
answer: Why? Are you planning on doing something to me?

question: A couple of things crossed my mind, in the car coming home.
answer: Door's open. What?

question: Holland! Captain Holland! pushes his way toward Holland. Two uniformed cops in the crush along the way. O'Malley comes up beside Holland.
answer: They always said Storm was superhuman. Now we know why he was always jacked up on coke!

question: Let me tell you something, you piss- ant. That man in there was the cleanest I ever knew -- with more honor and guts than this whole department put together. If I ever hear you say fuck all like that again, I'll lose my shield to put you where you belong.
answer: What the hell's I.A. doing up at this hour?

question: Taking over the show.
answer: This is Homicide, not Internal Affairs.

question: We got two cops down, with money and drugs all over the place. This is straight from the commissioner.
answer: You and Storm were tight, O'Malley. I'm sorry.

question: He was the most unstoppable sonofabitch I ever knew.
answer: Well.

question: Excuse me, are you with the police?
answer: (dully, showing

question: I've got a live cop, is what I've got. The paramedics called it wrong, so did my people at first. Look... it happens. The man had no vital signs. With all the blood and excitement, I almost missed it myself. But we have a pulse now. Your man is alive, Lieutenant.
answer: slips the cassette into his pocket. O'Malley makes a decision. Turns intensely toward the Doctor. Who else knows he isn't dead?

question: No one ... just the people in her. But --
answer: I want to see each one of them before they leave the room. No one else comes in as of right now.

question: Hold on. I don't think you --
answer: Mason Storm is going to vanish, Doctor -- and you're gonna help make it happen. Until he can give us some answers, the deader he is, the safer he is.

question: You're early again.
answer: You won't report me, will you? Inquiring minds want to know --

question: -- Dr. Cannon ordered a glucose drip on Jimmy See. Mack's E.E.G. monitor's developing a nice electronic hiccup -- and your boyfriend... ... turned his head.
answer: He did?

question: I thought he was going to sit up. I almost shit!
answer: -- Can you hear me, John Doe? I don't care what the doctors say, I know my words are reaching you somehow. I'm going to talk to you tonight... and tomorrow night ... and the night after that. I'm going to keep talking to you till you come back -- Yogi said it ain't over till it's over. Till the fat lady sings. There's life in you, J.D., I feel it. I'll never give up on you, and you'll never give up on yourself -- Besides ... you've got so much to live for. Sorry. I won't be long.

question: How's the sleeping prince?
answer: Still sleeping. It's bad enough when it's old people. But a young handsome guy --

question: Don't let this job get you, honey. It's eight hours, not twenty-four. Get out, meet somebody ... get laid --
answer: You can have my orgasms, Martha. I'll make up for 'em later.

question: Internal affairs. Detective Sergeant Jones.
answer: My name is Andrea Simpson. I'm calling from U.C.I. Medical Center. I'd like to speak with Captain O'Malley.

question: What is this in regard to, please?
answer: I have a John Doe coma patient, code access 461 zebra, with instructions to notify upon any change in condition.

question: What is the change?
answer: The patient has regained consciousness.

question: Miss ... please ... they won't tell me ... think I'm too disorient --
answer: This is U.C.I. Medical Center. You've been in a coma. Your charts go back for seven years.

question: Seven... years? Who ... who knows I'm awake?
answer: It's all over the hospital. You're the first one that's come out of a coma of this duration. You'll probably be on the news! You'll be famous!

question: Listen to me carefully -- -- Andy. I don't have the strength to talk much. I'm a cop. My wife ... family ... murdered. That's how I got here. If you don't get me out ... you and I ... good chance ... both be dead.
answer: Please -- you're in no danger here.

question: Goddamit -- can't stay here. Listen to me -
answer: I'll have one of the aides take you down the hall for hydrotherapy. It'll help you relax.

question: No --
answer: Listen... I've got work to do. You're my cutest patient, but you're not my only one. backs through the double doors at the other end of the hall, trying to balance an overloaded tray of supplies she's carrying. She and Ford are momentarily in full view of each other ... but backs turned. Suddenly -- Ford hears Andy! He spins ... gun ready.

question: Sonofabitch!
answer: My God!

question: -- Help me ...
answer: I'm sorry! Sorry --

question: Certain the world has gone insane.
answer: can't come in to work, are you crazy?! I can't even go to my apartment! People are dead, Martha ... no, I can't tell you where I am ... you're better off not knowing -- I am freaking A.W.O.L. I mean, what am I gonna do with this guy -- I want to help him... my God, he needs it ... but it's all over the T.V., he's some kind of crooked cop with drugs and murder and -- It's okay -- I'm here, I'm with you.

question: Yeah, that Esposito. The ignorant fuck who's broadcasting the news right now. Tell him it's Storm. Mason Storm. I can't stay here. They'll trace you from the hospital in two --
answer: I told you -- no one knows I'm here! I'm house-sitting... This place belongs to a doctor friend of my parents. He's in China now, on research... won't be back for six months. The medical center only has my apartment address. Even my friends don't have this number. Will you believe me?! We're safe here.

question: Esposito? Listen, you sonofabitch --
answer: We'll find your friend O'Malley. We'll just keep phoning ...

question: Listen. I'm getting out of here.
answer: I'll buy tickets to that.

question: I just need some food -- and a few days to get my strength.
answer: Days? Try a few weeks.

question: You helped me, okay? I'm grateful. But every day you keep helping puts you in more danger.
answer: Danger is my middle name.

question: I've been dead, Andy. You wouldn't like it.
answer: Hey, hey -- I don't think you get the picture here. Your muscles have been getting electronic stimulation at the hospital, but it's not like actually being up and bearing weight.

question: You're the one who doesn't get the picture. First of all, I ain't no fucking invalid! And second, I don't have time --
answer: grabs his arm and helps him back onto the couch. She exits the room and comes back momentarily with a bowl of rice and begins to try to feed him. Of course he takes the fork away and tries it himself, but by now his arms are so fatigued from the previous strain that they shake, his hand trembles and he misses his mouth -- getting the rice all down his beard. Spilling a little too much to ignore and at first it looks like he's going to explode. He looks up at Andy, who looks so sad. Mata Hari -- at your service.

question: Just some herbs I need for my recovery.
answer: No problem. This is on my list for Safeway every day.

question: That bad ... huh?
answer: I'll be in the other room.

question: That's enough! I don't care how many needles you stick in yourself or how much ginseng root you eat ... you have to sleep if you're going to recover.
answer: I slept for seven years?

question: That's an order! Jesus -- what a patient! -- You can't compare blood pressure readings now with when you were in a coma. It's not going to give a true measure --
answer: What's this reading? 555 over four digits --

question: That's crazy -- It's Martha's chicken scratches. Even she can't read 'em.
answer: I'll tell you what it is. It's a phone number.

question: I'm. sorry ... maybe I have the wrong number. I'm looking for Kevin O'Malley. My name is Phyllis O'Connor. I'm with the pension board of the Los Angeles Police Department. We have a misplaced check here for Captain O'Malley ... I'm sorry, we're not allowed to do that. Mrs. Wade, I'll be honest with you -- I'm not from the police pension board. My name is Andrea Simpson, I'm a nurse from U.C.I. Medical Center. You probably have no connection to this, and what I'm about to say will sound completely absurd to you. My patient is a police officer named Mason Storm. He's in trouble and needs desperately to contact his friend, Captain O'Malley. If you have any idea how to contact Captain O'Malley, please help me. I can't do that. Can I phone you? This is my number, Mrs. O'Malley. Yes ... you're right. I'm sorry. Oh, I'm sorry ... I didn't mean to interrupt. I, ah, well, I was just passing by and ... appears in the doorway, returning from the kitchen with a tray and glasses. She wears a robe and has that mussed, after-lovemaking glow.
answer: Thanks. Please. I'm sorry -- Sorry. I -- Why am I still in this fucking cage?! What's wrong with my body? Why won't it heal faster?!!

question: Mason, please I love you.
answer: Don't say that!

question: Why not?!
answer: Because I can't love you! Don't you see? It's seven years to anyone else. But it's only days for me. How can I be with you ... how can I want you and take you, when -- You seduced me. You came in here, looking that way, knowing just what the hell you were doing --

question: Yeah, I knew. What of it? I wanted you --
answer: You have no right to want me!

question: Then who does?! I've risked my life for you --
answer: Who asked you to? Not me!

question: You haven't stopped me!
answer: Then don't risk it! Don't do shit for me! I don't need you! stands in the midst of the graveyard, staring at --

question: O'Malley.
answer: -- It's Sonny, all right. Believe how big he got? He can throw a football forty yards -- He made it to my house, the night you got shot. I hid him, played it out like he was dead -- even staged a funeral, along with Felicia's and yours. They bought it. Everyone believed he was dead.

question: Where is he now? Is he safe?
answer: Trinity School in Ventura. Under my mother's maiden name, Wade. No one has any idea he's your son.

question: Then that was your mother. The one Andy found.
answer: Your nurse friend? Yeah. She left your number, I traced you to here.

question: O'Mal ... I can never thank you.
answer: Just seeing your ugly ass alive, that's enough for me. You wouldn't happen to have a beer around this joint --

question: I'd give my left arm to see Sonny, just for two minutes. But we can't risk it -- not yet. Not till I get Calabrese.
answer: Calabrese? Calabrese's dead. Someone blew the shit out of his Cadillac -- six months after you 'died.'

question: He did his thing -- then they waxed him. The two guys at the pier. They ordered the hit on me too. And I've got 'em on film. Still in the camera, right where I left it.
answer: -- That night in the hospital, I found the audiotape ... in your vest. I must've listened to it a thousand times -- looking for little quirks in the voices, phrases they repeat ...

question: Where is the tape?
answer: I turned it in for evidence.

question: What happened, O'Mal? To you? I'm sorry, O'Mal.
answer: That night there's a note in my locker -- letting me know it's not an accident. You know me, Storm. I never would've backed off. But there was Sonny to worry about too. What if they found him? What if they found you?

question: You did the right thing, O'Mal. We'll get 'em, buddy. Every fucking one of them. Get Sonny out of that school, O'Mal. Right now. With me alive and making a stink, whoever's on that film is going to be looking harder than ever for Sonny -- just to get to me. Get him someplace safe ... three thousand miles away if you have to.
answer: Consider it done.

question: I'm going straight to get that film. When you've got Sonny safe, bring me the audiotape. We'll put 'em together and get 'em to Esposito for the T.V. news. That should be quite a show.
answer: You got it, partner. You can always reach me through my mother. What about that nurse? She still in this?

question: Gone. For the best. For her best.
answer: Thanks for the brew!

question: I'm gonna take you to the bank, Senator Trent. The blood bank.
answer: Martha's dead. I won't leave you. Not ever again.

question: I won't let you. O'Malley was here.
answer: Here? How did you find him?

question: You found him. The old lady was his mother. And Andy ... my son's alive. hurls Joe Bear's massive body down upon the attackers! Jones takes the tonnage head-on and is crushed beneath it! Ford dodges, unleashes a burst of AUTOMATIC FIRE straight up at the balcony. Storm shoves Andy to safety onto the exterior balcony and dives there himself, just as the whole interior balcony is RIDDLED by Ford's BULLETS! I know this fuck. He's a cop! SLAMS THROUGH the metal GATE with JEEP BLASTING it. Holland! The other man on the dock --
answer: Are you crazy?! Get us outa here --

question: What the hell are you doing?!
answer: We just made the top of the chart, Andy. Every cop in the city thinks we shot our way out of a legitimate bust --

question: There are no cops here!
answer: Only 'cause they're too stupid. We need that film and we don't need any bullshit --

question: Goddamit ... for once, do something the non-violent way! Oh, that's the best time for us to see it! Then when you do come to sell, our office will know the upgrades you've made and we can market your home more effectively.
answer: New wall ... fucking yuppies! Better have this place fumigated -- quick. O'Malley left his mother's place three hours ago -- with the tape. He should be at the school by now, but she hasn't heard back from him.

question: Fuck the tape. We gotta get this film to Esposito or I'm gonna have a nervous breakdown.
answer: Mrs. O'Malley. Sorry ... listen. We're outside the Century Plaza now ... the hotel. Right, right. The one in Century City. Okay, listen closely ... Tell O'Mal to leave a message for us at the hotel desk. Leave it for Andy ... Andrea Smith. We're not gonna check in, it's too dangerous -- but the desk will hold the message if you tell them we're coming in this afternoon. Got it? Great. You're a champ, Mrs. '0.' You're gonna call Esposito. But not from this phone. Hey, hermano! You want this Jeep? Fuckin' smoking.

question: Esposito won't be here yet. He said three-thirty.
answer: He'll be there. Try O'Malley one more time. If you hear any lions roaring, haul ass. Don't worry. I'm a big boy.

question: He'll be there. Try O'Malley one more time. If you hear any lions roaring, haul ass. Don't worry. I'm a big boy.
answer: What a day, huh? Beautiful! Want some nuts?

question: I haven't got the film on me.
answer: I didn't think you would. Sit down. Take a load off. You do have the film somewhere, I assume? Developed yet?

question: Still in the camera.
answer: Good. Very good. That way I know you haven't duplicated it.

question: You know, Trent ... I could rip your fucking throat out before that sonofabitch over there could find the spit to sneeze.
answer: Oh, I'm sure you could, Storm. But not before one of those other gentlemen, across the way, could put a fifty-caliber slug through your brainpan.

question: Very well placed, Trent. But did you know that human reaction time -- even the fastest -- is between half and three-quarters of second? And in that time, I could easily --
answer: You could kill me now, Storm -- but you'll die two seconds later.

question: Be careful you don't get any of that guck on your sweater ... let me comb your hair before your old man gets here, it's stinking up in the back.
answer: Quit it, will you ... you're making me more nervous than I am already. My father's going to be more interested in seeing the real me.

question: I think I'm more nervous than you are, kid. We got out of my mother' place about two shakes ahead of the landlord ... know what I mean?
answer: My dad'll get 'em. You guys'll nail them all. You think he's gonna like me?

question: Does a bear dump in the woods? Are you kidding -- he's gonna love you.
answer: Let me see the tickets. Did you get us one of those sleeping cars? What time is he getting here anyway?

question: Soon...
answer: Hey, O'Malley! Long time no see. Taking a trip somewhere?

question: Make sure your father gets this ... Yeah. Me and my son are visiting my mother in New Mexico.
answer: Your son, huh? That's funny. He doesn't look much like you -- Does he, Turner? Enough of this fucking around. We want the tape.

question: Sonny -- run! Go! Sonny -- get outta here!
answer: Get the kid! He's under the cars!
